channel.title: Second relay after Whonix Gateway
channel.description:
Hi!
I want change my webrtc address. I doing whonix gatway->Ubuntu(changing webrtc)->WindowsXP
Ubuntu: eth1: 10.152.152.50 255.255.255.0 10.152.152.10
eth2 192.168.0.1 255.255.255.0 10.152.152.10
Now On my XP i set: 192.168.0.2 255.255.255.0 192.168.0.1
And now is my question. Is Windows XP safe?Am I stil anonymus?

item.title: Second relay after Whonix Gateway
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
komos:

I want change my webrtc address.

WebRTC is disabled in Tor Browser by default. Using other browsers is Unsupported.

komos:

Is Windows XP safe?

No. Hence, Windows XP is Unsupported by Whonix (and by Microsoft too).

What use case requires changing private LAN IPs but doesnâ€™t allow for disabling WebRTC altogether? Are there WebRTC apps banning 10.152.152.0/24 subnets?

Read full topic

item.title: Second relay after Whonix Gateway
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
komos:

I want change my webrtc address.

Just use a default Whonix-Workstation and Tor Browser and WebRTC will be
a non-issue.

Involving such a complex setup and Windows just for that does more harm
than good. Not worth it.

I doing whonix gatway->Ubuntu(changing webrtc)->WindowsXP

Entirely unsupported. (
https://www.whonix.org/wiki/FAQ#What_do_you_mean_by_unsupported.3F )

Now On my XP i set:
192.168.0.2
255.255.255.0
192.168.0.1

Wrong IPs. - The standard way on using a Custom-Whonix-Workstation:

Whonix

Other Operating Systems

Anonymize any Operating System! Your operating system tunneled through the Tor Anonymity Network! Create your Custom-Whonix-Workstation!

And now is my question.
Is Windows XP safe?

XP:

No. (Use a search engine to find out why.)

On windows generally:

  • https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Computer_Security_Education#Windows_Hosts
  • https://trac.torproject.org/projects/tor/wiki/doc/TransparentProxyLeaks

Am I stil anonymus?

Requirement of anonymity is security.

Read full topic
